alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 3:31PM EDT until April 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...From this evening to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14 feet, Minor flooding expands into the woodlands... fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will be flooded with around one foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 6.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 13.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 12.0 feet and begin rising again Thursday morning. It will rise to 12.2 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
